oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Olfactometer screening of repellent essential oils against the pollen beetle (Meligethes spp.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Daniel, Claudia
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Cereals, pulses and oilseeds
Crop health, quality, protection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Essential oils can have an impact on pollen beetle (Meligethes spp.) host plant location behaviour.Highest repellency values were obtained for Mentha arvensis, Cymbopogon flexuosus, and Litsea cubeba.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Daniel, Claudia (2014) Olfactometer screening of repellent essential oils against the pollen beetle (Meligethes spp.). Poster at: Xth European Congress of Entomology, York, UK, 3-8 August 2014.
